task.summary:
- Read serial is working - Node mapping is working - Draw circles and lines is working
+ About to make NodeMapping a class. + About to integrate Serial reading, Node Mapping, and GUI

- Read serial is working - Node mapping is working - Draw circles and lines is working
- Class Serial() has been made - Class NodeMapping() has been made - Serial() has been integrated in NodeMapping()
+ Integrate NodeMapping in GUI + Draw mesh topology according to relation_list[]

- Read serial is working - Node mapping is working - Draw circles and lines is working
- Class Serial() has been made - Class NodeMapping() has been made - Serial() has been integrated in NodeMapping()
+ Integrate NodeMapping in GUI + Draw mesh topology according to relation_list[]

- Read serial is working - Node mapping is working - Draw circles and lines is working
- Class Serial() has been made - Class NodeMapping() has been made - Serial() has been factored out from NodeMapping() - UI_window has a function to run node_visualizer() task thread - Serial() instantiated in main(), passed in to UI_window.node_visualizer(). The serial works well
+ Integrate NodeMapping in UI_window.node_visualizer() + Draw mesh topology according to relation_list[]

- Read serial is working - Node mapping is working - Draw circles and lines is working
- Class Serial() has been made - Class NodeMapping() has been made - Serial() has been factored out from NodeMapping() * OMITTED: UI_window has a function to run node_visualizer() task thread. * OMITTED: Serial() instantiated in main(), passed in to UI_window.node_visualizer(). The serial works well - Created GetMeshFromSerialThread (QThread). It instantiate Class Serial and NodeMapping. When mesh topology BitArray2D available, it emits signal to Class UI_window so that the node topology gets repainted in the main window.
NOTES: - ESP8266 occasionally gives wrong mesh json string. It is much more complex than the actual. Observed, it happens when nodes are connected and disconnected +

- Read serial is working - Node mapping is working * OMITTED: Draw circles and lines is working
- Class Serial() has been made - Class NodeMapping() has been made - Class GetMeshFromSerialThread() instantiates Serial and function recursiveNodeMapping - Added serial setting label - Combine PyQt with Networkx in a window. Works well.
NOTES: - ESP8266 occasionally gives wrong mesh json string. It is much more complex than the actual. Observed, it happens when nodes are connected and disconnected +

- Read serial is working - Node mapping is working * OMITTED: Draw circles and lines is working
- Class Serial() has been made - Class NodeMapping() has been made - Class GetMeshFromSerialThread() instantiates Serial and function recursiveNodeMapping - Added serial setting label - Combine PyQt with Networkx in a window. Works well.
- Added class BroadcastDialog and SingleDialog popups when a node is clicked on the GUI. - Added Set and Query functions on the popup dialogs, and tested together with ESP8266. They work!
TODO: - interpret the set-reply and query-reply - query-reply should be added to the node's properties
NOTES: - ESP8266 occasionally gives wrong mesh json string. The nodes mesh is much more complex than the actual. Observed, it happens when nodes are connected and disconnected +

- Read serial is working - Node mapping is working * OMITTED: Draw circles and lines is working
- Class Serial() has been made - Class NodeMapping() has been made - Class GetMeshFromSerialThread() instantiates Serial and function recursiveNodeMapping - Added serial setting label - Combine PyQt with Networkx in a window. Works well.
- Added class BroadcastDialog and SingleDialog popups when a node is clicked on the GUI. - Added Set and Query functions on the popup dialogs, and tested together with ESP8266. They work!
TODO: - interpret the set-reply and query-reply - query-reply should be added to the node's properties
NOTES: - ESP8266 occasionally gives wrong mesh json string. The nodes mesh is much more complex than the actual. Observed, it happens when nodes are connected and disconnected. It is the problem of ESP8266 painlessMesh
++ This commit is before cleaning up codes.
